description: a(n) = s(1)s(n) + s(2)s(n-1) + ... + s(k)s(n+1-k), where k = [ (n+1)/2 ], s = (Fibonacci numbers).
comments: Contribution from Wolfdieter Lang, Jan 02 2012 (Start)chat(n):=a(n+1), n>=0, is the half-convolution of the sequence A000045(n+1), n>=0, with itself. For the definition of half-convolution see a comment on A201204, where also the rule to find the o.g.f. is given. Here the o.g.f. is obtained from (U(x)^2 + U2(x^2))/2 with U(x)=1/(1-x-x^2),the o.g.f. of A000045(n+1), n>=0, and U2(x):=(1-x)/((1+x)*(1-3*x+x^2) the o.g.f. of A007598(n+1), n>=0. This coincides with the o.g.f. given below in the formula section after x has been divided.For the bisection of this half-convolution see A027991(n+1) and A001870(n), n>=0.(End)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, May 03 2000
